subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Hertz vs Gauss, Attention RJ, oranyone else who may know

full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0004_01CA6E17.D359A090

Thanks!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, November 25, 2009 3:05 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-I=
TC] Hertz vs Gauss, Attention RJ, oranyone else who may know


    
       =
 Hertz measures frequency in cycles per second.  Not strength.
        And =
it can be used to measure the frequency of anything (for example, sound), n=
ot just EMF.

        Gauss is more complicated.  It seems to be the satura=
tion or density of magnetic flux, which relates to the strength of a magnet=
ic field, which relates to the strength of EMF.

        Or something like =
that.


        --- On Wed, 11/25/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieg=
hostresearch.com> wrote:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@abercro=
mbieghostresearch.com>
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Hertz vs Gauss, Attenti=
on RJ, oranyone else who may know
          To: "EVP-ITC Group" <EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com>
          Date: Wednesday, November 25, 2009, 1:33 PM


    =
        

          Recently someone asked me the following question:

    =
      [I am brand new to the world of paranormal investigation. I believe I=
 have a good grasp on what hertz and gauss measurments are, however am conf=
used as to all of the differences between them. Hertz has more to do with t=
he complete cycles per second and gauss is the strength of an EMF. I guess =
where I am fuzzy is in my lack of physics. I thought frequency is also a me=
asurment of strength. I may not be making much sense here, but can you tell=
 me where I am missing somthing?]

          My answer was that I wasn't en=
tirely sure myself but I think that Hertz measures the wave frequencies of =
the entire electromagnetic spectrum. Gauss only measures the intensity or s=
trength of EMF generated around these wave frequencies. Depending on the ra=
nge of hertz, an EMF is generated.

          I told him that I would check=
 around with other people in the field to make sure.

          Was I corre=
ct?

          Thanks!
          April
